title: unfortunately goggle play store has been stop error & application can not update so please resolve

thread.text: unfortunately goggle play store has been stop error & application can not update so please resolve

Welcome to Android Central. First, so you understand who we are, we're just users like you are, we're not Samsung nor Google. We can't resolve your problem directly, but hopefully we can help you correct it. So, when you try to update the Play store you're getting an error. Can you tell us exactly what the error is? Are you sure you're correctly logged into your Google account? Are you seeing any other problems with the phone?

title: Marshmallow 6.0.1 now available on OPX

thread.text:
6.0.1 OTA is now available (Canada) w/ October security patch, seems faster but could simply be UI tweak. Stable so far. Upgraded from 2.2.3.
Not expecting Nougat, but there may be other ROMs. Cheers.

Had the community build of Marshmallow since that was release. This new release definitely seems a bit more stable. Love having Dose now. The one thing I'm a bit down on though is auto brightness. Feels way to lax after the upgrade to Marshmallow. I could have it under the sun and it won't get brighter for about 30 seconds+ and sometimes not at all. It was slow before the update also, but now its just borderline unusable.

Works well for me... It may be a the sourced component is not as sensitive.
I've had problems playing music on Google Play Music through my Bluetooth headphones for three months, sent in my phone many times and tried different official OS versions and couldn't get it to work until 3.1.3.. touch wood.
Wasn't a happy camper.

Better late than never 
Marshmellow update is welcomed with open arms.
A droid a day keeps the Apple away

title: OnePlus X Lacks Major US LTE Bands

thread.text:
I was getting super excited for this phone and then I read the PC Magazine article and found this:
"The OnePlus X may also have a critical problem for U.S. buyers. It has LTE bands 1/2/4/5/7/8. It's missing 12 and 17. That means while it's compatible with AT&T and T-Mobile, it's missing the low-frequency, 700MHz bands (Bands 12 and 17) that have the best suburban, rural, and in-building coverage. This means the OnePlus X will have significantly worse LTE coverage on AT&T and T-Mobile than competing phones."

replies.text: I was excited too until I checked the bands. Band 17 is the most widely used LTE band in my state so it's off my list. With any of the Chinese phone makers you have to check what bands it supports.

thread.text: If it doesn't go through T-Mobile's VoLTE certification, I doubt it will get Band 12 LTE support.

No band 17 = Fail
IF this had band 17, it would be a no-brainer to buy this for $250. Looks like Asus Zenfone 2 Laser or Alcatel Idol 3 for me
It's the same story for me, I'm on AT&T and Band 17 is HUGE in my area. OPX fails right out of the starting gate for me which is sad as I love my OPO.

Just for some clarity, it is not a horrible experience for all users on AT&T. I am actually seeing better LTE signal where I live with my OnePlus X than with my LG Nexus 5X. It all depends where you live. I was worried it would be a horrible experience, but it is not. Personally, I also love to use the device way more than the Nexus.
Anyone know if this phone will work on the bell mobility network in Canada? I hope so i just ordered one lol

Let us know if it works with Bell.
The phone works with Rogers and Fido.
Phone has the looks, OS is a little half baked and may have some bugs, OS 3.1.3 seems stable (me), some have said they are having problems.
OnePlus support are not too helpful but try their best.
Others have had no problems with all versions of the OS... It could be the parts they get for the devices are not consistent to specs (my guess).

title: Oneplus X won't detect any SD cards

thread.text:
Hello everyone,*
I have a Oneplus X, I'm on Oxygen 2.2.1-X, Android 5.1.1, system is updated... the SD card is a SanDisk ultra 16GB microSD that I've been using for 2years or so without any problems. 
Since yesterday my phone won't detect any SD card. I was listening to music, all of sudden got the message saying I can take out the card and since then it's impossible to use any SD card. My phone doesn't detect my usual card, it won't allow me to install it manually in the settings, when I connect my phone on my PC via USB I can only see the internal storage... (I can't find my SD adaptator to try it) but anyway I thought my card was fried and that I lost all my data.
I tried with another SD card, same problem. No detection, can't install it, nothing. But with the 2nd card, I left the phone with it and idk how but the option to install it manually in the settings just reappeared (well I was able to click on it) but when I try to do so, nothing happen, phone vibrate but seems to not be able to even start the operation.*
Very very frustrating. So now I don't know if it's the phone, the card, or the slot. 
Hope someone can help me.
Have a nice day and thank you.

Welcome to Android Central! The SD card could be corrupt, defective, or counterfeit--or there might be a problem with the phone's SD reader. If you have access to another phone that will recognize the card, then insert it and install SD Insight to see if the card is genuine or counterfeit. Counterfeit cards are programmed to report more storage than they actually have, and if you try saving more than the card can actually hold, then files can start getting corrupt.
If it's a valid card, then go to Settings>Storage, Unmount the card, remove it, and insert it into your computer, if possible. If you don't have a microSD adapter, buy one at your local electronics store--they should only cost about $2. Can the computer read these files? Backup as much as you can right now, then run chkdsk to look for bad sectors: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-sd-card.html.

Thank you! 
I didn't know about the storage ting, I know my SD was almost full before what happened, I will try all the solutions then and hope it's not my phone's SD reader!

Hello again, 
I didn't have time to buy a microsd adapter but tried the SD card in another phone and it didn't recognize it either. 
Anyway I had some things to do during the day/evenings so I put back the SD card in my phone and left it like this the entire day, around 9pm my phone vibrate and write the message saying it's ready to mount the card??? So I do it and now it's working perfectly fine, got all my datas back... I really don't know what happen, SD insight seems to tell me the card is OK but I will backup all my datas just in case and also buy a new one.

title: Oneplus X got locked for no apparent reason

thread.text:
Experts,
My Oneplus X got locked and it won't allow me to log in to my phone using the same Google account that was previously synced with this phone. It says: Verify your account - this device was reset. To continue sign in with a Google account that was previously synced on this device.
This happened yesterday when I removed the phone from my pocket and found that the device got locked for no apparent reason. Its been prompting to verify my Google account that was last synced with this device. I tried entering my Gmail address and password however it keeps telling me - please sign in using one of the owner's acounts for this device. Now I'm surely using the correct Gmail account (as I have only one google account) however it keeps telling that. One thing that happened was, I reset my password at the very beginning when this happened as I couldn't remember my password at that time. 
I have been using Oneplus X for about 5 months now and never had this problem. 
How do I fix this. Please suggest.
Thanks.

title: How is the device(overall)? Thinking of buying one...

thread.text:
Need to know mainly the battery life and how much does it take to charge full. Which version of android is it? And is the camera better than one plus one, moto x play or one plus 2?
Posted via the Android Central App

I recently bought one and I'm actually loving it, specially the dark mode in the settings.
The battery is better than my moto G 2014(running CM13), it lasts me all day and even a little more, and I'm not sure how much it takes to charge to full since I let it charge overnight.
It runs 2.2.1 (5.1.1 lollipop) and it's going to be updated to M.
I haven't used a oneplus 2 or a moto x play but I don't think it is better than those but it isn't bad at all, it takes the pictures really fast, faster than any I have used and the quality is decent.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: when i will get the volte support in my cell phone(one plus x)

thread.text:
NETWORK	Technology	
GSM / HSPA / LTE
2G bands	GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 - SIM 1 & SIM 2
3G bands	HSDPA 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100 - Europe
HSDPA 850 / 900 / 1700(AWS) / 1900 / 2100 - USA
4G bands	LTE band 1(2100), 3(1800), 5(850), 7(2600), 8(900), 20(800), 38(2600), 40(2300) - Europe
LTE band 1(2100), 2(1900), 4(1700/2100), 5(850), 7(2600), 8(900) - USA
Speed	HSPA, LTE
PLATFORM	OS	Android OS, v5.1.1 (Lollipop)
Chipset	Qualcomm Snapdragon 801
CPU	Quad-core 2.3 GHz Krait 400
GPU	Adreno 330

Is this on par with OnePlus One or worse? Is there any point on changing to this one? I find this one more beautiful!
I'm really really interested in getting this phone. The price and the build quality are so ummatchable. I don't care about the lack of LTE. So what is the other downside here?

replies.text:
I've been using my One Plus X for about one month. It's a great phone. Downsides are; no NFC. Camera is good enough not stella or amazing but I don't care. WiFi works on the 2.4 not the 5 Ghz. Plenty fast enough.
The software oxygen OS is pretty snappy. No lagging which is very nice.
Call quality is very good. Actually better than my LG G3 on the same network. I'm on T Mobile band 4 which is their LTE band. 12 not available. 
Anyway. Go get this phone. You won't regret it.

title: OnePlus X LTE in Chicago

thread.text:
After 2 days LTE coverage in Chicago has been overall good but not perfect. Won't know the situation downtown until Monday, but so far it's decent on the north side.
Overall really enjoying the feel & speed of this phone, using it as a backup to the 6P. They compliment each other very well, as the OPX feels like a great change of pace.
I'll update LTE coverage info if folks are interested.
Also I recommend NOT buying the rosewood case...looks cheap with horizontal lines running across it. Didn't even open the package (has to be unopened to return).
Posted via the Android Central App
Are you on ATT or Tmobile?

At&t. My office is at Wacker & Madison downtown. I maintain LTE connection throughout the day both inside and outside, as well as on the blue line underground (quite surprising!). Download speeds aren't great, varying wildly between 5-30 mbps, but the LTE logo almost always remains active. And full disclosure, the 6Ps download speeds were about the same in the city.
Posted via the Android Central App
I knew it wouldn't be so bad in the wild.
I'm surprised as well. I've maintained LTE all the time in upstate NY using AT&T.

One Plus X user in northern Atlanta. Using a company called Ting that is a MVNO of TMobile. Using band 4 with LTE coverage 97% of the time. Pretty happy overall. 
Download speeds around 16 to 18 mbps. Upload 4 or so.
I am about 33 miles north of Atlanta. I actually like this phone. Have a LG G3 which is a great phone too.
Look and feel of this phone is great.
I would suspect that One Plus will have to to do a firmware software update for bands 12 and 17 for AT&T. Question is; do they care about the U.S. market?
Anyway. Just a little input for you.
Posted via the Android Central App

In Chicago's Ravenswood neighborhood I am getting 37.19 down and 7.02 up on MetroPCS (T-Mobile) with my OnePlus X.
This is way more than adequate for me. I typically shut off LTE and use H+ anyways. Just more stable.

title: Few pictures

thread.text:
Yesterday the DHL guy stopped by, and left a rather small package. As the OnePlus X is going to be a present for my son, I had to wait with the unboxing until he went to bed.
At last I could take the lid off the box. The phone looks great. And it feels even better when held in hand. The specs may not be top-notch, but the phone has nothing cheap about its looks. For sure it is not light, thanks to the metal frame around, combined with glass in front and back. It has rather premium feel about it.
It went back to the box for the time being. I will do some basic configuration in the coming days, and I am sure my son will appreciate the upgrade from my old Blackberry 9810 he is currently using 
As the title says, I am attaching few pics (taken with my Blackberry Z30).
Looks nice the way its packaged! nice phone.
It's hot as hell. I'm a bit afraid of the screen cracking though...

title: Complete Failure - DOA

thread.text: This phone looks like complete failure, just DOA !! Oneplus has its own forums filled with ppl looking to giveaway their invites and still no one taking it !! Seems the phone specs are equally responsible with invite system for the failure...
I'm puzzled as to why they decided not to make the phone compatible with the majority of US carriers' LTE bands. That couldn't have helped sales at all.

250 - 300 million people in USA
1 billion in Europe (let's not even mention Asia) 
maybe there was a spec/cost trade off and they weren't too concerned about North America.

Yeah, their main markets are India and China, with a combined population of over 2.5 billion people.
I wonder how many of those people care about at&t bands and NFC... It's not zero, but I bet it's close.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Oneplus X call waiting option shows incoming call instead of missed call when there is a call in the

thread.text:
1. Oneplus X call waiting option shows call as incoming call if there is any call in background during any conversation. It should highlight background call as missed call with a icon on top bar.
2. During making any call, there is no visible sign if phone is ringing or subscriber busy. No visible display /color change that call is matured only you have to see small call duration to identify it.

title: RECEIVED MY 1+X three days ago.

thread.text:
I received my Oneplus X 3 days ago. Great little phone. I needed a back up phone and the X is perfect in that regard. 
For £200 ,this phone is a no-brainer!
Battery life is great, so far the S801 CPU is chugging along pretty well.Display is good if you like AMOLED. 
Camera is average but don't care since I have iPhone 6 for my mobile photography.
It's quite a looker. A svelte high end design.
Posted via the Android Central App

Congrats! I am enjoying mine as well. I bought the Sandstone case and am very please. I removed the stock screen protector and don't feel the need to add one at this time. The only disappointment for me is the camera, mainly because I have been using the Nexus 5X since launch. LTE is fine in my area on AT&T. Build quality, in hand feel screen and speaker make my Nexus 5X look like the cheaper phone. It is also noticeably faster at app loading and multitasking than the Nexus 5X.
That's great, congrats! With the specs and looks of the OPX, no doubt it's an awesome phone at that pricetag.

title: Oneplus X or Oppo Find 7 Reloaded? Which would you take?

thread.text:
Hello,
I'm struggling to make a choice between these phones, and I was wondering if anyone had some perspective to offer. Particularly someone with experience with the Oppo.
My current benchmark is a Nexus 4. My primary concerns:
- Good battery life, the longer, the better. I browse the web a lot and would probably play games.
- Minimum 1080p screen. No negotiations.
- mSD is a plus
- Roms or current OS version mandatory. Oppo seems to have it up to Android 5 (with CM M on the way) so that's something, but I really like how the oneplus X looks.
The struggle is real! Please assist!

I am in the same situation but I really prefer the size of the X and the look.
Battery life ist not much different
And install roms is way easier on the X
Posted via the Android Central App

Comes down to size preference. Although I'll say Id have a slight bias towards the OPX because the AMOLED screen is just so beautiful. AMOLED screen tech has made leaps and bounds in improving color accuracy. Insofar as ROMs the OPX will probably eventually have many more ROMs than the Find 7, but Oppo have released an ASOP alternative to their Color OS, which might help it a bit if you don't like the default OS.

replies.text: I think the OPX supports the adoptable storage system of Android Marshmallow. If this is your only fear then you'll be good to go once OP upgrades OxygenOS to Marshmallow.

thread.text: Not a complete homerun for me, but at the price I'm willing to make certain tradeoffs. Main negatives for me are no NFC and no B12 LTE. Considering that I had pre-ordered the One A9, the battery size isn't too bad on the OPX. At $150 less than the One A9 I may just reconsider things.

replies.text: It's almost my ideal smartphone, but I need B12 and B17 LTE.

Oneplus X is my new phone. I come from Moto G 1.
Looks more promessing and yeah just like it more

thread.text: I wonder why they didn't go for usb-c for this device

I have owned the Moto G 2GB (2015) and have the Nexus 5X. IMO, the OnePlus X is superior to both. The only disappointment is the camera, mainly because the 5X is one of the best out there. Everything else feels higher end both when holding it and using it. IMO, the Nexus 5X doesn't feel much faster than the Moto G... but the OnePlus X speeds past both.

title: Thinking Of Getting A OnePlus X

thread.text:
I just have the 4G LTE question
The way I understand it is:
ATT - You may get LTE here and there, but you may lose it quickly. You will be on HSPA
T-Mobile - You can get it fine now. But they are switching their LTE band so you will be in the same position as ATT. When not on LTE you will be on their 3G which is HSPA+ which in my area, Baltimore is almost as fast as LTE and sometimes faster. So not a big problem.
I may be all wrong or spot on. Could someone help clarify and correct where needed. 
Thanks

I am enjoying mine. I bought the Sandstone case and am very please. I removed the stock screen protector and don't feel the need to add one at this time. The only disappointment for me is the camera, mainly because I have been using the Nexus 5X since launch. LTE is fine in my area on AT&T. The overall build quality, in hand feel, screen and speaker beat my Nexus 5X IMO.

title: Got my invitation, but it's worthless without LTE

thread.text: I would jump on my invitation if the X had Band 17 for ATT LTE. The phone is worthless without that LTE coverage. What a bummer!!!!!!!!!!

I agree, that stinks. I'm on T-Mobile and they're starting to roll out B12 in my area, but even my B12-equipped phones connect via B4. I'm still reluctant because I want my phone to be reasonably future-proof.
Makes no sense. The TWO has B17

Contact one plus about the Band 12, Band 17 frequency for T- Mobile and AT&T. The chat went as follows:
Server Message:
Please wait. A OnePlus Support Representative will be with you shortly.
*10:23:12 AM
Johnedel said:
Hello Angel. My name is Johnedel how can I help you?
*10:23:24 AM
You said:
Interested in the one plus x, wondering if their will be an update for the band 12, band 17 for LTE ATT?
*10:25:54 AM
Johnedel said:
Thank you for reaching out. As of the moment, we are still working on this matter. We'll keep you posted on the forums about any updates on this.
*10:29:39 AM
You said:
The hardware of the one plus x has the capability for an update to band 12, 17?
*10:31:11 AM
Johnedel said:
Device is compatible with some of the network carriers frequencies. It may work.
*10:34:29 AM
You said:
It works but not on 4G LTE AT&T, simple question does the hardware on the one plus x have the capability to upgrade the firmware to carry the band 12, band 17 frequency?
*10:36:31 AM
Johnedel said:
Yes. It can carry the band but as of the moment we have some compatibility issues with the networks. We will update you on the forums about any progres on this matter,
*10:38:21 AM
You said:
Thank you.
*10:38:43 AM
Posted via the Android Central App

Just for some clarity, it is not a horrible experience for all users on AT&T. I am actually seeing better LTE signal where I live with my OnePlus X than with my LG Nexus 5X. It all depends where you live. I was worried it would be a horrible experience, but it is not. Personally, I also love to use the device way more than the Nexus.
